com.ericsson.commonlibrary.proxy

Class Proxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ericsson.commonlibrary.proxy.Proxy

  • public final class Proxy
extends Object
    The proxy library's only entry point. All features that Proxy library has can be reached from here.
    Author:
    Elis Edlund (elis.edlund@ericsson.com)

      • delegate

        public static <T> T delegate(Class<T> proxyInterface,
                             Object... delegates)
        Create a object with a specific interface/class that delegates all method calls to the delegator objects passed in as parameters. Notice that you can get polymorphic behavior with this delegation method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        proxyInterface - interface/class of the returned class.
        delegates - Objects that implements the methods that should be used as delegate methods.
        Returns:
        a proxy object that delegates method calls to it's delegates.

      • delegate

        public static <T> T delegate(T objectThatShouldDelegate,
                             Object... delegates)
        Let a existing object delegate all or some of its method calls to some delegate objects passed in as parameters. Warning your proxy will not behave polymorphically.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        objectThatShouldDelegate - object that should delegate to other objects.
        delegates - Objects that that implements some methods.
        Returns:
        a proxy object that delegates all/some method calls to it's delegates.

      • javaBean

        public static <T> T javaBean(Class<T> classToProxy)
        Creates a java bean object from a interface or a abstract class. (java bean=class with getX(),setX(),isX() methods) If the interface/abstract class does not contain corresponding setX method for a getX method the setX method will be generated. These generated set methods will only be available with reflection.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        classToProxy - the interface/abstract you want to create a java bean from.
        Returns:
        a concrete usable java bean object.

      • javaBean

        public static <T> T javaBean(Class<T> classToProxy,
                             boolean primitiveDefaultIsException)
        Creates a java bean object from a interface or a abstract class. (java bean=class with getX(),setX(),isX() methods) If the interface/abstract class does not contain corresponding setX method for a getX method the setX method will be generated. These generated set methods will only be available with reflection.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        classToProxy - the interface/abstract you want to create a java bean from.
        primitiveDefaultIsException - if primitives should default to exceptions instead of (0, false 0L etc)
        Returns:
        a concrete usable java bean object.

      • addTimerToMethods

        public static <T> T addTimerToMethods(T objectToBenchmark)
        Add a performance timer to a object. The performance timer uses slf4j to print stats about a method invocations.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        objectToBenchmark - object that will be intercepted with method timings.
        Returns:
        a proxy object

      • mdcLogging

        public static <T> T mdcLogging(T objectInNeedOfMdc,
                               String key,
                               String value)
        Set a MDC key to a specific value while inside the object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        objectInNeedOfMdc - object to add mdc logging to.
        key - mdc key
        value - mdc value
        Returns:
        a proxy object

      • recursiveIntercept

        public static <T> T recursiveIntercept(T objectToIntercept,
                                       Interceptor interceptor)
        Let's you add an interceptor recursively to a existing object. Meaning that the interceptor will add itself to every returned object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        objectToIntercept - the object you what do add a interceptor recursively to.
        interceptor - the interceptor you want to add.
        Returns:
        a proxy object with the interceptor added.

      • intercept

        public static <T> T intercept(T objectToIntercept,
                              Interceptor interceptor,
                              Method... methodsToIntercept)
        Let's you add a interceptor to a existing object. It's possible to specify which methods the inteceptor should intercept and if no method is specified all methods will be intercepted.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        objectToIntercept - the object you what do add a interceptor to.
        interceptor - the interceptor you want to add.
        methodsToIntercept - varargs of the methods you want the interceptor to intercept. Specifying none means that it will intercept all.
        Returns:
        a proxy object with the interceptor added.

      • intercept

        public static <T> T intercept(T objectToIntercept,
                              InvocationHandler invocationHandler,
                              Method... methodsToIntercept)
        This method allows you do use java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler to intercept method calls. InvocationHandler is part of the java API and can not be used to intercept concrete objects (with this library it can). Lets you add a InvocationHandler to a existing object. It possible to specify which methods the invocationHandler should intercept and if no method is specified all methods will be intercepted.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        objectToIntercept - the object you what do add a interceptor to.
        invocationHandler - the interceptor you want to add.
        methodsToIntercept - varargs of the methods you want the interceptor to intercept. Specifying none means that it will intercept all.
        Returns:
        a proxy object with the interceptor added.

      • intercept

        public static <T> T intercept(Class<T> classToIntercept,
                              Interceptor interceptor,
                              Method... methodsToIntercept)
        Let's you add a interceptor to a proxy object created from the specified class/interface. It's possible to specify which methods the inteceptor should intercept. if no method is specified all methods will be intercepted.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        classToIntercept - the class/interface you what do add a interceptor to.
        interceptor - the interceptor you want to add.
        methodsToIntercept - varargs of the methods you want the interceptor to intercept. Specifying none means that it will intercept all.
        Returns:
        a proxy object with the interceptor added.

      • intercept

        public static <T> T intercept(Class<T> classToIntercept,
                              InvocationHandler invocationHandler,
                              Method... methodsToIntercept)
        This method allows you do use java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler to intercept method calls. InvocationHandler is part of the java API and can not be used to intercept concrete objects or for non interfaces (with this library it can). Lets you add a InvocationHandler to a classes/interfaces. It possible to specify which methods the invocationHandler should intercept and if no method is specified all methods will be intercepted.
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        classToIntercept - the class/interface you what do add a interceptor to.
        invocationHandler - the interceptor you want to add.
        methodsToIntercept - varargs of the methods you want the interceptor to intercept. Specifying none means that it will intercept all.
        Returns:
        a proxy object with the interceptor added.

      • getProxyInterface

        public static InterceptableProxy getProxyInterface(Object proxy)
        Returns the same proxy object as you passed in but with the InterceptableProxy interface
        Parameters:
        proxy - an object that is already has been proxied.
        Returns:
        the provided object but with the InterceptableProxy interface.

      • changeInterface

        public static <T> T changeInterface(Class<T> newInterface,
                                    Object objectToChangeInterfaceOn)
        Allows you to change the interface of a object to one that it does not implement. Duck Typing,
        Type Parameters:
        T - target object type
        Parameters:
        newInterface - the new java interface proxy should implement.
        objectToChangeInterfaceOn - object that could that has methods an unimplemented interface has.
        Returns:
        a proxy object with another interface than the original.
